title: PHPendswitchKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPendswitchKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Close a
switch
conditional block:
<?php
$a = 4;
switch($a):
case 1: echo "One"; break;
case 2: 
  echo "Two"; break;
case 3: echo "Three"; break;
default: echo "Many"; 
  break;
endswitch;
?>

Definition and Usage
The
endswitch
keyword is used to mark the end of a
switch
conditional which was
started with the
switch(...):
syntax.
Related Pages
The
switch
keyword.
Read more about the switch statement in our
PHP switch Statement Tutorial
.

★
+1

practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
$a = 4;
switch($a):
case 1: echo "One"; break;
case 2: 
  echo "Two"; break;
case 3: echo "Three"; break;
default: echo "Many"; 
  break;
endswitch;
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPendswitchKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPendswitchKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPendswitchKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
